comments.author: zoe
comments.content: Truly a whopper cake! Love it!

comments.author: herbivore=only eats plant products
comments.content: The term "herbivore" in the title of your blog is very misleading.  An herbivore does not eat any animal products (cheese, butter, eggs included).  That would be an omnivore.

comments.author: Anh
comments.content: I need to google "whopper cake" (haven't heard about it at all here down under). But it sure looks good!

comments.author: Alessandra
comments.content:
Happy birthday to your daughter Michael!

In regard to the name Herbivoracius, my first impression of it was that is was mostly a 'fun' name, like some non-vegetarians often call vegetarians/vegan and anyone who eats a little bit different...I have been called herbivore, brown bread, little bird, rabbit...all sort of names. I don't get offended, and I often use them myself to make myself understood (to some people - mostly those who say "here is the normal food and on this side the rabbit food...' these people need a fun approach or they can put you down!).

Of course I am not a 'herbivore', rabbit, little bird or a slice of brown bread! My diet is larger that that.

But certainly I would not use the word omnivore as I don't eat fish and meat.

Also herbivores eat a variety of insects with their grass, so they are less vegetarian than me!

What do you think?

comments.author: The Hungry Mouse
comments.content:
Oh fantastic! I love it! Happy birthday to the little mouse. :D

+Jessie

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: Alessandra's comment below sums it up for me - I think you are taking things a little too seriously if you are worried that the blog is called Herbivoracious, but I'm actually lacto-ovo vegetarian. At any rate this is the only negative comment I've received about it in almost 2 years of running the blog.

comments.content: This is so great!!!!!! happy Birthday to the little one!
